This top is great and comfortable -- it's not at all itchy since there is nice lining on the inside. But note that unless you are on the short side/have a short torso, this top will run a bit short. I'm 5'7" and it hit right above the waistline of my pants, but if I lifted my arms up it become a crop top. In my opinion, it fits shorter than it looks on the model.

links_Review_Title: Great first day of work outfit
links_Review_Text: Was very comfortable and none of the pieces fell off during my long flight. It looked good for my first day at work and was comfortable enough to wear on a plane for 3 hours. I'll rent again for a date night

links_Review_Title: Unfortunately I couldn't wear this top as it was way too boxy.
links_Review_Text: I loved the fabric but the way this shirt hangs is not flattering at all. It's very boxy and runs very big.
This top has zero give so size up if you want to chance it. I was unable to wear it

links_Review_Title: Great shirt but too short for me
links_Review_Text: I didn't realize this would be a short shirt with midriff exposed...limited where I could wear it.
Cropped but not too cropped; great for girls night!

This top was amazing! Simply adorable! Ran true to size but it was to short. I'm in my 40's and granted I do have a killer stomach but for me it was not appropriate for a woman my age to wear a top with their belly showing in my opinion..
Fits a touch small
Super cute for bachlorette party. Slightly irritated my arms because I wore it dancing, but still a good find

I can't get over how soft and comfortable this top was. All the sparkle usually comes with itchy or starchy material on your arms, neck or other clothing. Not this top! Super fun for a concert and night on the town. Lots of compliments! It is short so pair with something high waisted unless you are going for the midriff look! Love love love and very pleased with this rental.
This top is flattering, lightweight and well-lined (read: not scratchy!) You will want to wear a high waisted bottom because it is quite cropped.

links_Review_Title: Great party top! Very flattering and fun.
links_Review_Text: I loved this top. It's a great color - gold/copper with black undertones. It is a little cropped so I wore with high waisted jeans. Got a lot of compliments.

links_Review_Title: The sparkly top with jeans was just the right amount of comfortable and fun!
links_Review_Text: The fit was perfect and as others have mentioned it's a cropped top but not too short. Paired with jeans and leather jacket. I received many compliments and would definitely rent again.

links_Review_Title: Brought a sparkle to my overall outfit
links_Review_Text: The high cut wasn't great for my body type, but is a great piece.
Really lovely, a little stiff but beautiful piece for feeling the the heroine of a historic novel Pair with white sneakers for a modern look

links_Review_Title: Little House on the Prairie X New York
links_Review_Text: Obsessed with this dress!! Got so many compliments, such a unique look. Occasionally had to tell people I wasn't a colonial reenactor, but some people just don't understand #fashion...def worth a rent!

I love this dress so much, I really wish I could keep it. It's so fun to wear, and it fit me like a glove. It's tight in the chest area with no give, just like a dress from 1850 would have been! and it really made me feel amazing and romantic. It's definitely unique and drew a lot of compliments. What you see is what you get with this one, it's a must rent for me.

This dress was so fun to wear! It feels a little like a period piece but works for a range of occasions. I wore it out on a Saturday and got several compliments. The neckline is graceful, the fabric is wonderfully light, and it has pockets! It's clearly made well too. Wish I had reason to keep this longer.

This dress looks almost like a costume - which isn't necessarily a bad thing; I love playing a character with my clothes. But it is skirting the line of being a little ridiculous. You could put a bonnet on and literally look like an extra in a Western film. I wore it in a photo shoot in West Texas and it was pretty appropriate and looked v v epic. However I would never wear this in the real world. LOL. But it was fun for dress up. Also, if you do plan on wearing this IRL - which, more power to you if you are - the shoulders and sleeves are a bit tight. I could not lift my arms very high, or easily reach my arms out for anything. Also it was a pain to zip and unzip. More of a two-person job if I'm being honest. Really beautifully well-made garment, though. Very flattering and impeccably made. It will make you feel like a sexy, upscale understudy for Ma Ingalls.

links_Review_Title: Finally had my American Girl doll moment
links_Review_Text: LOVED this dress. If it were a bajillion dollars, I'd have kept it. I always wanted to wear the American Girl doll Felicity's dress, and this is like that meets Elizabeth Bennett. Husband did not understand any of my references or attraction to this piece, but I adored it.

I love Brock Collection but the sizing is different in every single garment I rent! This one gets mixed reviews but I love the neckline & fabric so I rented anyways. I'm a true size 6 but rented an 8 because their clothes seem to run small. Well, this dress has a lot of fabric and runs big and I hate how the pockets sit at the widest part of hips. Yet, I'm still intrigued & it has a lot of potential so I'm going to rent the 4 or 6 next time to see if it's more flattering.
I love this dress so much and I'm so bummed it didn't fit! It was extremely small in the chest and arms.

links_Review_Title: I wanted to wear it but couldn't.
links_Review_Text: The other reviewers said it was too costumey but I insisted that I could make it work. I was wrong. Between the low cut neckline and the strong costume vibe (it's historical feeling in both silhouette AND print/material), I couldn't wear it. I put it on and got ready for the day but changed before I left.

links_Review_Title: Too small for large breasted women
links_Review_Text: I really loved the cut of this dress, but if your breasts are large, this dress will not fit you. I wear a size 12R in a regular dress, and it fit fine over everything except the bosom. Won't zip up. Great fabric and lovely pattern though.

links_Review_Title: this is a lovely dress, but not worth the retail price AT ALL
links_Review_Text: it is very colonial, and reminds me of Felicity the american girl!
This dress is SOO beautiful but it didn't fit.
Beauty! But didn't fit across the chest.
Loved this dress but I'm a 36DD and it smashed my girls into a weird uniboob. If I sized up it to fit my chest I would have been swimming in it.
I am curvy and love maxi dresses. But this was... weird haha. I don't recommend unless you are super skinny
So cute! A bit costume-y in a colonial sort of way but that's why I wanted it so it was perfect! True to size

The zipper is sewn in poorly making it difficult to get up without help (Like the fabric would cross over, not too small, it just would get stuck, which is ridiculous for such an expensive dress.) i got into it by zipping it over the waistline and then twisting it around.

links_Review_Title: I wore this dress on vacation in New Orleans. It's gorgeous. The cut is very flattering.
links_Review_Text: Very romantic
Beautiful and expensive dress
Chest area is too large and too low cut

links_Review_Title: Love the color and it fit great.
links_Review_Text: I recommend for work

links_Review_Title: Loved this dress, but it was really small.
links_Review_Text: I absolutely loved this dress, although I felt it ran a bit small. I think a larger size would have fit me a bit better as this size was extremely cleavage bearing on me, but overall still loved it. I'd definitely rent it again in a larger size.

links_Review_Title: Worn to a bar party and to work! Such a flattering cut and color
links_Review_Text: If puffy sleeves are wrong i don't want to be right. I love this dress so much & am *thisclose* to buying it -- it's so versatile and well-made, not to mention the bright red color is so striking!!! See more pics on @thanksitsrtr

I was so dissapointed by this dress! Its a true wrap dress but ran small and SO SHORT, even the sleeves were too small so they didnt puff up properly. I'm very comfortable showing some skin and even for me it was unwearable :(

links_Review_Title: I want to own this dress
links_Review_Text: I loved this dress so much I am going to see if I can buy it. It's a fun, bright, cheerful color. It's a real wrap dress, so you thread the tie through, giving some flexibility to size. I tied it super tight so it showed off my curves but you could tie it looser. Two things of note: it was WAY shorter on me than it was on the model. I was covered but I did need to be conscious of my movements to keep from flashing people. The arms are also a bit restricted - you can't reach too high so not good if need lots of movement. The puff sleeves were fabulous and stayed pooped the entire time. I did have to iron it when it arrived. Made a HUGE difference, specifically around the neck area so would not recommend renting if you won't be able to iron.

I had to go in to the RTR store in Georgetown last minute after two horrible dress picks. I hand selected this dress, half as a joke and half out of desperation...and I'm so glad I did! This dress is so cute, flattering and fun! I'm usually a size 6, but the large fit perfectly. I highly recommend this dress! I felt awesome in it!

links_Review_Title: Cute but runs super small and was SO short

links_Review_Text: This dress is super cute and I probably should have gone with the large but it wasn't available so i rolled the dice with the medium. It was a little unflattering in the smaller size so I didn't end up wearing it. It is also shorter than I thought it would be.
Super cute, super flattering, runs small but size up, kind of me feel 80s prom with the shoulders but in the best way possible
Ran really small and crazy short, I felt like I was wearing a dress for a child. I'm only 5'2" and this was a medium. Just strange.

links_Review_Title: Short and not secured in the right places
links_Review_Text: It's super cute when you are standing still in front of the mirror. But that's not how people live their lives. When actually walking around, the slightest breeze blows the flap open and exposes your entire crotch area. It's also pretty short so it's impossible to bend over at all. If you have an event where you will be standing perfectly still with no air movement, then this is the dress for you.
Couldn't possibly wear. Super short too. Should have ordered a L

This dress is super cute, but I took a risk renting without any prior reviews and it definitely bit me- this dress ran SO small I wasn't able to wear my standard dice or even the back up size. Definitely size up 1 or perhaps 2 sizes when ordering this one. It's also really short- and I am only 5'1- so taller gals beware!

links_Review_Title: It was super cute and good quality, but was pretty short and also low cut.
links_Review_Text: I really loved the shoulders of this dress and rented this as a backup when another dress wasn't available. It was a tad too short though, I'm 5'5" and it was a little too short on me. I ended up just wearing it out to dinner one night.
I don't think this dress is sized properly. The medium fit around my waist but didn't close properly in the chest (and I'm small chested.) disappointing because it could be cute.

I received a lot of compliments on this one, overall it was a good get. I am usually a size 6, and wore the M. The small for but was less flattering on my mid section. The M was a little loose in the bust (34 D) but when I tightened the straps all the way it was manageable. The sequins were a little rough ony underarms, but that's to be expected.
True to size, flattering style. Perfect for a Great Gatsby party.

The fit was perfect. The bust is a little baggy and I had to tuck my bad boys in several times but that's my own problem. It was super comfortable and easy to move around and dance with! The slip stayed in place. Loved it!!!

Loved this dress. I am usually a size 10 or 12 depending on designer this large fit perfect. At 5'4" I sometimes have length issues but this was perfect. Shorter in front longer in back. It was nice and stretchy. Comfortable to dance in. Would definitely rent again

This dress accentuated my curves and looked very sexy. I used fashion tape to keep it in place up top which I often need to do with anything low cut because I'm small busted. The sequins were not over the top but a more subtle, fun embellishment. Would definitely rent again- LOVED this dress!

I got a ton of compliments on this dress! It looks great on and the fit was perfect! It even has a snap on the front to make sure your boobs don't fall out (they thought of everything!) only reason I didn't give it 5 starts was because the sequins kind of chafed my arms a bit. It wasn't unbearable or anything but definitely noticeable. I would wear it again though!

links_Review_Title: This dress fit great for a 90's themed party.
links_Review_Text: It was shorter & had a lower neckline than expected. I had to wear a size up and did have to pull the skirt down quite a bit. I got quite a few compliments on it though.

Loved this dress. It's very flattering. I normally wear a size 8, and I ordered the M and L in this dress. I ended up wearing the M, because it is very stretchy material and it fit a little better than the L. I wore it to an NYE party in Las Vegas. It was the perfect combo and flashy/sparkle and sex appeal. Not over the top or too under-dressed! I loved it!

links_Review_Title: I wore this for a New Years Eve party and received a lot of compliments!
links_Review_Text: Absolutely loved this dress. It was shorter on me than in the original picture

links_Review_Title: Two days after Christmas and I was NOT feeling my smallest......
links_Review_Text: Great fit....angles to flatter. A million compliments on all the sparkle. Wore it with a cropped fur shrug

Fit well, the dress was slightly clingy around my stomach but the cut and sequins made it flattering! Bra situation was a little tricky but I ended up going without and used some bra tape to make sure I didn't flash anyone mid dance floor. Overall happy with the look and fit!

This is a pretty and fun dress-- especially around the holidays! I didn't wear it mostly because i didn't love not being able to wear a bra and i didn't feel like wearing pasties/going bra-less for the work Christmas event i had this pictured for. I'd rent again for another event though!
This dress was slimming and elegant, perfect for a cocktail-type charity event. It laid nicely on me, not too tight; I normally wear an 8 in a dress. I would rent this dress again in a heartbeat!
I am pretty tall and the length on this dress wasn't what I expected.
Wore with tank

links_Review_Title: fit perfectly, got lots of compliments!
links_Review_Text: super comfy too!
Small strap which easily broke but otherwise perfect

I wore this dress to a disco-themed party and it had just the right amount of bling without being over-the-top. The slightly flared bottom is flattering around the tummy. I was concerned about the slit for dancing but the dress is lined. I received lots of compliments.

links_Review_Title: i didnt' get to wear it... it was too small... not very flattering if you are bloated
links_Review_Text: too small, nice if it fits

links_Review_Title: Nice. I chose a different dress.
links_Review_Text: Nice option.

links_Review_Title: I wore this dress on New Year's Eve and got a lot of compliments!
links_Review_Text: Great fit and very flattering.

links_Review_Title: Not great for longer torsos, but very pretty
links_Review_Text: I ordered the XS and while it did fit, I didn't find it flattering on me. Wrap dresses (even faux like this one) usually work great on my pear shape, but the waistline on this was an inch or two too high for me. I have a longer torso, so maybe that's why, but it just didn't hit at my narrowest point, so I looked oddly shapeless. That said, if you don't have a long torso, I think it's worth a shot. The sequins are very eye-catching, and it felt comfortable.

links_Review_Title: I got so many compliments when I wore this dress. It sparkled but was still subtle.
links_Review_Text: A bra with a deeper V would have been good. My strapless bra showed a little bit it, but it definitely looked nicer with a bra to support the girls. It's fitted but doesn't have a lot of structure to push up boobs. It has a little underskirt so when you sit down you're still covered up when the slit moved, which I loved. The velvet adjustable straps were also a great feature. Worst part was some itching from sequins under one of my arms where I think it was a bit tight, but it was tolerable.

I wore this dress to a murder mystery party, and it was perfect. Fun and glamorous. I didn't wear a bra with it because my strapless bra was visible (I have small boobs so it was fine), but then midway through the party, I realized that there was a little button in the chest area to make it less low-cut. Wish I knew that from the beginning, but it was fine either way.
I rented this for work- but it's way too short. I'm 5.5 and this was very short on me. Wonder if I sized up it would have had more give. Very cute though! Lots of compliments
Worked well for a nice but casual day at work. Comfortable

links_Review_Title: Knowing exactly what I was going to wear for an event.
links_Review_Text: Very unique piece. Fit true to size. Received lots of compliments.

Pro - Weight of skirt is perfect for winter style and cut very flattering and it hides my challenging mid-section. Con - Adjusting all day, didn't wear tights per recommendation but there's soo much skin exposed when you walk. Didn't feel comfortable with this at work. Wouldn't rent again
Really liked this skirt but wore it with tights and they kept sticking to each other so it would ride up and bunch all day. Next time- no tights

links_Review_Title: Different: sexy and yet (casual) workplace friendly
links_Review_Text: I loved wearing this skirt in my super casual workplace. Needed spanx for a smooth look, wore it with a cropped black t-shirt and cowboy boots. A little surprised by the stiff, almost burlapy nature of the fabric, but that may have been what was needed to make the intricate pleating at the waist. Which did NOT make my stomach look bulgy, so all good.

links_Review_Title: Very unique design and I got a lot of compliments.
links_Review_Text: I did not like the quality of the skirt. It looked like it was run through the regular wash and it was not lined, which made it feel somewhat cheap.

Great work look. Fit was great and skirt was comfortable. The fabric felt a little rough on the hanger but the skirt is lined and fabric looked great on. I work this skirt wit combat boots for a fall look and got lots of compliments.

links_Review_Title: Cool concept but the skirt was too worn down
links_Review_Text: Thin material good for summer
GORGEOUS! Loved wearing this skirt and even made my husband do a double take. Absolutely loved it!
This skirt fit perfectly in a 4 - normally I am a 6.
Waaay too short for sitting down. Many compliments while standing up
It was worn and a little fuzzy.

links_Review_Title: Super Cute! May be a little short in the front for work.
links_Review_Text: I wore to work with high black boots and black sweater and loved! Received a lot of compliments.
Perfect for date night

links_Review_Title: Runs small. Mini skirt is lined, long skirt fabric is thin
links_Review_Text: Runs small and sits high on waist. Fabric of long skirt is thin and clings to the mini skirt or tights.
Very cool. Runs big so it was not flattering. If I had gotten the smaller size I may have liked it more.
Was a bit tight in the waist, but otherwise fun.

Pros: I received lots of compliments on this skirt, and I liked the originality of the design. It looked great with a tight black top and tights on a cold day. Cons: If you wear it with tights, the slip is cotton (not satin) and it rides up underneath. Make sure you have static guard! Also, I found that the skirt was pilling - otherwise I would rent again.
Material is very thin. But it works.

links_Review_Title: nice twist on warm fall/ winter skirt
links_Review_Text: Loved it- nice length and design features, comfortable. I wore it with mini heeled boots.
Fantastic skirt! Fits true to size

Rented this as part of my unlimited. Fit true to size and just like the picture - I am petite so it was all a bit longer on me, which made the under skirt more work appropriate (not too mini). It lay beautifully and was comfortable to wear. I have had great success with interesting Amur skirts and this was no exception. A great rental.

links_Review_Title: It's very elegant. It looks professional yet very feminine.
links_Review_Text: Pros are that it's lightweight and flows nicely to show off legs. Cons is that it wrinkles easily.

I bought this to wear for work. It's super cute and fit was right on. Unfortunately, the skirt underneath was a true mini on me (I'm 5'6") so it wasn't appropriate for work. So I don't think I'll end up wearing it, but if I had another event non-work, I'd wear it.
The fabric is light and airy and fit like a dream. Very flattering and easy to dress up or down. Loved the adjustable straps as well. Thinking of buying!

links_Review_Title: Perfect floral gown for formal summer wedding
links_Review_Text: The straps are long and can be kind of annoying, but overall I liked their addition. It's very easy to iron the straps with a hair straightener, so don't let the reviews regarding them being wrinkled deter you from ordering. The fit is pretty tight in the abdomen area, with the breast area being relatively large... again, this is workable if you have the proper bra coverage ( I wore pasties, but it would've been better to wear some sort of full pasty cup because the fabric can sort of flatten the girls out). Length was perfect with 2 inch heels. Received many compliments. Fabric is nice and light; it was 100 degrees outside and I didn't suffer in this dress.

I absolutely loved this print! It doesn't wrinkle at all and is so comfortable. I normally wear a small but this ran a tad narrow in the waist/ribs. I ended up going with the medium even though it was a little large. There isn't any support up top so it might be tricky for large chests. I'm 5'9 and this hit right at floor length with flats. Highly recommend!

links_Review_Title: Perfect design for a hot summer event...but for the ribbons!
links_Review_Text: First the positives: the print is gorgeous and contains a lot of subtler highlight colors including pink, bright orange, pale mint green, red and bright orchid purple, so coordinating accessories is a snap. I got tons of compliments. Fun to dance in and really lightweight, wore this to an outdoor wedding on a 90 degree day and stayed pretty cool thanks to the flowing bottom and exposed shoulders! But then, the negatives: as many reviews have already mentioned, the ribbon straps that you have to tie yourself are messy, a huge hassle, and detract from both the overall look and comfort of the dress. They arrived wrinkled and were tricky to flatten, I couldn't tie them alone and they never hung evenly. They didn't stay tight, so I had to enlist help throughout the night to re-tie them - constantly felt like I was moments from toplessness! A better and neater solution would have been to knot the ribbons and pin the knot inside the dress-and from the pinholes I found in the ribbon, someone else had already tried this. I'm 5'9" and pretty flat-chested, and when I tied the dress tight enough to feel secure it was a couple inches shorter than I would have liked, as you can see from the photo. I think this dress could be great for a shorter person good with creative knots!

Oh man this dress was so fun. 100% silk, light weight, bright stand out colors (with a background of black for those like me who don't wear color too often), and so easy to wear. Not a single bad thing to say! I wore a L as the M didn't zip all the way (back zip). Order your go-to size and the next size up!

I got this to wear to a Graduation dinner with my colleagues. This was very pretty. The regular length was okay with heels on my 5'4 frame. The straps were difficult to deal with. Combined with the low back and the inability to wear a bra, I returned without wearing due to it being a bit risqué for an event with coworkers.
Beautiful dress, the silk feels so luxurious. A bit hard to get the ties right on shoulders though, and they loosen over time.

I have rented this twice, both for day time but I'm totally different ways! The first time was at the breakers and I dressed it up kept it clean&it was a show stopper. The second (shown in this pic) I wore it as a cover up In St Barth's. Love this dress!
Bright and beautiful. Fabric has no stretch and is a little tight around the busy and rib cage. I'm 5'8" and wore the MR with flats and length was perfect.

Blended in perfectly with all the Indian wedding colors and florals! Fit was amazing. Didn't get creative with the straps, but love that the straps had potential to do just about any design/knots you could envision

The fit was tight around the upper torso, so I ended up wearing the larger size. At 5'9 with 3" heels, the dress was a little short, but the flow of the fabric hid this. It is very flattering! I thought the straps would be too loose and that the dress would fall throughout the night, but they stayed tight and it was no worry. Highly recommend.

Wore this for NYE and got showered with compliments all night. The silk jersey is warm and comfortable to wear. I tied the straps at the nape of my neck for a more 1930s' look, and to keep them from falling off my shoulders. Wore with a NuBra and fashion tape to prevent gapping at the bust.

links_Review_Title: It was beautiful and I received tons of compliments. I loved it! One of my favorite rentals.
links_Review_Text: I struggled a bit to zip it- I'm a true 4. After I ate, it was a little tight, haha, but overall, it fit pretty true to size. If you're on the fence about sizing, I'd size up based on the tightness around the chest. The straps were a little fussy too- they kept coming undone throughout the evening. I had to keep going to the bathroom to retie them. Definitely double and triple knot them. The dress was beautiful though, highly recommended.

Adored this dress and was SO sad to take it off at the end of the night. I got so many compliments and it was perfect for a wedding - easy to move in, lightweight, and the most beautiful silhouette. Did run a tad tight in the ribcage area but not uncomfortable. I was not bothered by the long straps at all and in fact, it was one of my favorite details on the dress. Do make sure you have a friend to help you get dressed as the straps can be hard to tie yourself. Lastly, if it was available in a SP that would have worked better but I was still able to wear the dress with 4'' heels so it did not drag too much. Overall, would definitely rent this stow stopper again.
The dress is gorgeous the bra line is slightly tighter when you zip up the zipper than the waist

I am 5'2.5" and between sizes XS and S, or S and M in some brands do to my 34b/c cup size (which I am also between). So since I'm sort, and generally small fits pretty great, I went with the SP. It was tight on the chest, but fit like a glove everywhere else. Tight just under the boobs on the ribcage as well. I wore espadrille shoes that are 4.5" in the back and 1.25" in the front. So even though it is petite, it was still a bit long, but these shoes were perfect for the dress to hover just above the ground. No support or padding on the boob area, so the super smooth and silky fabric squished the ladies a bit. Since I'm just barely busty, the tightness kept them in place, though it pancaked them a bit. Probably best for women with a B or under, but I still relay liked the dress overall.

links_Review_Title: pretty pattern but the dress is a hassle
links_Review_Text: loved the vibrant print and fabric, but overall the dress was too much work. the ties were a total hastle and not reliable for support; i ended up tying the front two ties around my neck and tucking the back two into the dress, so i didn't wear as pictured on the model. it was also tight in the chest/stomach.
Received compliments all night. The straps are awesome and can tie in a few ways. Highly recommend!!

links_Review_Title: Perfect dress for a wedding guest!
links_Review_Text: This dress is so comfortable I wish I could wear it everyday! I’m 5’3” and wore the size 8 (LR) as the petite length was unavailable. It was pretty long on me even with 3” heels but, I did not trip on it at all and was easy to hold up when I walked or danced. I loved the look of the long straps but it was pretty difficult to tie/adjust and had to double knot so it wouldn’t come undone. Either way I would definitely rent this dress again!

links_Review_Title: Love it, so beautiful and fun! Flowy and fabulous
links_Review_Text: Little tight if you have a big chest, but I made it work!

Absolutely adore this dress! Great fit for tall girls. I could even wear heels with this and it looked great. The print, the flow, the colors, all AMAZING! The only con to this dress are the straps which look like they need a bit of ironing and are very long. Be careful with them and be sure to tie them properly!

One of my all time fave rentals. This dress was gorgeous. It made a statement but never felt too fussy. I didn't need a bra and it fell really nicely. I agree with previous reviews you should take the time and iron the ribbons out. Also maybe double knot them, which I didn't do initially and almost had a situation. Gorgeous dress!

Wore to a bridal shower but definitely could dress them up especially with how rich the fabric and pattern are. Loved the colors, floral and material. The straps on my shoulders were the only tough part as they didn't stay tied but I could have double knotted them. It was slightly small through the chest and rib cage. Good length for taller girls

Fun to dance in and loved the ribbon detail. It was very comfortable to party in all day/night. Some reviews say the ribbons are hard to iron out, but I did not find it difficult at all. Highly recommend for a classic, feminine look!

I wore this for a Friday night wedding welcome party. Despite being in a very hot & humid place, I did stay cool in this, and the silk fabric did not get sticky as I would have expected. The top did gape a bit on the sides, but that's expected with a rental. The colors were gorgeous and the shape, flattering. Would recommend!

links_Review_Title: Bright and fun dress for a Cape Cod Wedding
links_Review_Text: Unlike other reviewers, I found this dress TTS. I am usually a 4 or 6 and the medium fit me perfectly. I had sized up for my back up (I would've ordered a SR and MR) and got a LR and it was enormous. I have a fairly small bust (34B) and didn't feel like it was too revealing (as others also stated). The ribbons did take some time to iron out and to figure out how to tie appropriately so it was flattering but definitely worth it. I received compliments all night on this dress and would highly recommend it to anyone looking
So many compliments! Very comfortable and the most beautiful floral dress in person!

links_Review_Title: Make sure you tie those straps tight!!
links_Review_Text: Very cute dress interesting fit but overall liked it. The straps are silk material so you need to make sure you double knot the straps. Dancing made them loose and almost fall off!
As described. Bow tie straps are totally adjustable. Need a friend to tie them. Great dress.

links_Review_Title: Perfect Outdoor Evening Wedding Guest Dress
links_Review_Text: I'm between a small and medium these days. Based on the other reviews, I sized up. It looked like it was tailored for me - perfect fit! So lightweight and elegant. I received compliments on it all night, then again when they noticed the long ties on the back of my shoulders. If you're looking for a wow-factor dress, this is it. Be prepared to iron the ribbon ties but it's 100% worth the time.
Very light and airy dress! Great for a night of moving and dancing. Ribbon straps arrived very wrinkled but took the time to steam them straight and overall looked great!

I love this feminine dress by Goen. J! Running true to size with no stretch, I recommend wearing your true size for your primary size and going up for your back up. This style is fitted throughout the midsection and fitted at the hips. It works for all cup sizes. You are not able to wear a standard bra with this dress so you should wear nubra or no bra since there is an open back. This dress is supposed to be floor-length, so definitely be mindful for that. The pattern on the dress is flirty and fun and the ties add a unique look. Awesome for a small gathering/baby shower!

links_Review_Title: Beautiful dress for a "in Bloom" fundraiser
links_Review_Text: Dress was beautiful but tight in the bust! I had to wear a sweater, but I had a perfect one in my closet

links_Review_Title: Stunning but too messy to wear.
links_Review_Text: Stunning dress, I typically wear a medium and a large was snug around bust and rib cage. Could not wear because the ribbon straps looked super messy. Ribbon needed to be steamed to lay flat and I did not have the time or patience to fuss with the dress. Wore something in my own closet.

This dress is amazing. The ribbons hanging down the back make for such a feminine and dramatic effect. I got non-stop compliments all night. It's soft and easy to dance in. Runs a little long but nothing high heels can't help with. Rent this one it's so fun and so comfortable!

links_Review_Title: Solid wedding option, slightly snug in wasit
links_Review_Text: Comfortable but snug, if I wear again may size up to give more room at waist where it is tight as zipper. Unable to wear a bra. Felt like I had to have good posture to not show stomach or let too slip too much, but not overly worried. Length fine with 2-4 inch heels.

Rented this as a backup dress but did not wear. My typical size small/4 fit great, but at 5'2", the dress was too long for me, even with heels. Would consider renting again in the petite size. The fabric is also a thin, silky material. This would be more appropriate for a spring / summer event.

links_Review_Title: Beautiful pattern but polyester not silk
links_Review_Text: Didn't end up wearing because it was damaged but RTR was quick to help me out! I do want to note this dress is listed as silk but it's 100% polyester which was disappointing. Otherwise the pattern is beautiful and fit was easy and flattering.

links_Review_Title: Dress is pretty, but go up one size.
links_Review_Text: Dress is pretty, but go up one size. The top was very tight and I was uncomfortable all day and night.

links_Review_Title: Pretty! Can be dressed up or down.
links_Review_Text: Great maxi dress. The long ribbon straps are different and very pretty. They came really crumpled though so I took the advice of another reviewer and ironed them out. Plan to double knot the straps because they will come undone. I have a small chest and the SR fit well with stick on bra, so not sure how it would work for a larger chest. At 5’8.5” I wore flats and the dress just touched my toes. Wore dangly earrings and my rings, but no other jewelry needed. The dress is enough.

links_Review_Title: I loved the way this dress looked, super romantic and spring-y. I regret not purchasing it.
links_Review_Text: Like others have mentioned, these buttons do NOT stay closed. Luckily I knew this from reading the reviews and testing it out before leaving the house. I reinforced with safety pins from the back.
I gave it 4 stars not five because it's a touch unforgiving in the material even though the cut is super flattering.
Perfect for afternoon brunch or a casual wedding! Low cut but not overly sexy.

Just as an FYI, the dress had some sparkle and there panels on the side of the top are a bit sheer (you can see my bright pink bra -whoops) but I got SO MANY COMPLIMENTS from COMPLETE STRANGERS about this dress. So soft and comfortable too!

As previous reviewers noted the buttons down the dress are a frequent problem, but I came prepared with safety pins and had three down the top buttons. It is a slightly deeper v-neck than I'm usually used to but it never felt truly revealing. I didn't find the metallic thread through the fabric all that itchy as previous wearers had noted, even wearing it through the final day of a very hot and humid vacation and then through the airport and onto 2 planes. Overall great dress and I would have considered buying, just wish the buttons weren't such a pain. Lots of compliments, breezy, light, and comfortable!
This dress is flowy & beautiful. The detail is lovely. What people say about the buttons is true. The dress wasn't tight or pulling but the buttons around the waist repeatedly came undone.

This dress has a low cut but is very conservative! I always feel very uncomfortable with very low cuts because I am busty but this dress hit in the right places and show the right amount of cleavage. The only issue is the little buttons do come undo ALOT!!! I would recommend if you are willing to put up with the buttons all day long

Super flattering. Size 0 still had looseness to it but as other said buttons popped opened regularly (otherwise it would be 5 stars). Wore regular bra. Several people asked where to buy it they liked it so much. Material is quite thin- not see-through but doesn't provide much warmth.

links_Review_Title: From play dates to date night, loved this flowing fit!
links_Review_Text: #daytime #dayintonight #babyshower
Nice dress, but buttons kept coming undone.

links_Review_Title: The silver thread running through the fabric adds a level of unexpected sophistication!
links_Review_Text: I got tons of compliments on this dress! You will likely need to safety pin the buttons in the waist and bust to ensure they don't come open, but otherwise very comfy and easy to wear.

Definitely base the size off your chest. I got the size 2 and have B cups and it was tight throughout the chest and one of the buttons kept popping undone. Only wore it a couple hours so the itchy material wasn't too bad with a tank top underneath. The material is light and flowy and the color/design is beautiful. It would be nice for a day event or shower but wouldn't recommend wearing it all day since I had to keep adjusting the top buttons.

Slimming design. Gorgeous fabric. Metallic thread is a bit itchy at first but then it was fine. I had same issue as some others with middle buttons opening but fixable and worth it. Loved the longer length. Bust not too revealing.

What everyone says about the buttons are true, they come undone anywhere that's not perfectly lie-flat (for me under the boobs). It was long but not too long on my petite self. Super cute and light for summer tho!

Love this dress! Paired with a pair of black Victorian lace-up boots, this dress turned heads. I felt elegant and confident out on the dance floor. Dress has metallic threads running through the fabric, adding a touch of sparkle. The only snafu was a button on the waistline, it kept popping open. Easily remedied with some fashion tape.

links_Review_Title: Loved it! Felt effortless and chic
links_Review_Text: a little tight on the chest but overall perfect fit
Dress is beautiful but the third button was opening constantly. Fixed with a safety pin! Otherwise, it fit nicely, I was able to wear a strapless bra, and length was flattering.

I got lots of compliments on this - wore it first to an outdoor press conference then on an out of town trip. The plunging neckline works for someone like me who's not very busty. There is a hint of shimmer that I don't think is reflected in the photos, but I don't think this makes it feel too dressy.

links_Review_Title: Lovely dress, but the buttons make it impossible.
links_Review_Text: I wore this dress to a Passover Seder (thankfully via Zoom in my own home). While it is very pretty and flattering, the buttons won't stop popping open. I read this on other reviews, and was prepared. I found, though that even after using fashion tape and safety pins, another button in a different spot would open up. I thought about purchasing this dress, but can't play whack-a-mole with my clothes .

links_Review_Title: Worn to dinner at the beach.
links_Review_Text: Very pretty. Very plungey.
The metallic thread was really itchy.

I think this dress is so flattering and the fit was perfect. Usually I have to pin low cut dresses especially as I have a short waist but I didn't need to with this one. The fit was just right. The buttons do come undone so I had to pin the ones by my waist and it was fine. I wore this a few times and felt beautiful. The material is a little itchy but I didn't mind.
Trust the other reviewers. The top/bottom proportions on this dress are ridiculous. I sized up and I still couldn't get the top closed at all. Had to return it unworn.
Beautiful dress
The fabric is very much like sheer stationery, although it isn't quite that sheer. Very delicate and pretty, very understated although it has a shiny thread that runs through it. Nice enough.
Comfortable. Too low cut for works, but still looks cute with a lacy bralette or tank under to make it more modest.
Somehow i ordered a size that was too small
Loved the length, great for any occasion.

links_Review_Title: Love the vintage-y feel of the dress.
links_Review_Text: Fit is true to size, however a couple of buttons kept popping open. Most likely due to # of times it's been rented/dry-cleaned.
Cute dress, but the buttons come undone.

links_Review_Title: Cute dress but buttons kept popping open.
links_Review_Text: Loved this dress and really wanted to wear it. It fit perfectly but unfortunately the buttons are not sturdy. Every time I moved the buttons came undone on the top. I'd try it in a bigger size but It will definitely be too big.
Very comfortable dress
Everyone was correct about the buttons, and it was a little to low cut. Buttons will not stay closed, and worried about the whole thing pooping open! Didn't wear.

links_Review_Title: I love this dress. It's not nearly as low cut as it looks in the photos. Very romantic and pretty!
links_Review_Text: The fit is great but be warned BA&SH runs very small. The 3 is their largest size and I'm a size 8 and it fits me. Also, for some reason, as another reviewer noted, the buttons pop open. The dress isn't tight so there's no reason for them to pop open, they just do. Was a little annoying when I discovered it in the middle of dinner, but I used a safety pin the second time I wore it.

This dress is gorgeous. In person the fabric is super detailed, which you can't tell from the pictures. The fit is incredibly flattering and emphasized my waist while hiding problem stomach areas. I was afraid the cut in the front would be too low, but it was perfect. The only reason why I deducted a star is because the buttons come undone constantly. This dress fit perfectly, and yet, with almost every movement and breath buttons at the top and in the stomach area would pop open. I fixed it with a few strategically placed safety pins and that solved the problem, and was well worth it because the rest of the dress was so great!

links_Review_Title: Great dress for any formal occasion!
links_Review_Text: Fits true to size. Only issue is the buttons kept popping just below the breast.

This dress was really beautiful, but the fabric was SO itchy that I ended up not wearing it. It also has a little tiny bit of shimmer thread woven throughout, which is really pretty (you just can't see it in the photo.)

links_Review_Title: A bit too see through for me!
links_Review_Text: Pretty but a little diaphanous

This was a gorgeous dress. I wore it to work. I did feel slightly self conscious about the bust area because it's quite low cut. The only thing that was a true issue was the button underneath the bust kept popping open but it wasn't too tight.
Better have a good supply of safety pins.
It was a very comfortable dress! Perfect addition to Caribbean vacation!

Awesome maxi, easy to pack since it's a thin cotton. Definitely more of a vacation look. It's a bit showy in the bust area, so also works well as a cover up. Great for smaller busts. Runs true to size, but has no stretch.

I was mindful of previous reviews that this dress is see-through. It is, BUT there is a pattern so I felt like the top hid everything nicely and I didn't have to wear a bra or swimsuit underneath (but I'm pretty small-chested). The fabric is very light and comfy, but it did come quite wrinkled. I had it pressed. One thing I didn't love is that the silhouette is amorphous so it really doesn't show-off the figure. It's supposed to be like that, I know, but I'm curvy and I don't think it was the most flattering dress on ME. Would look better on a straight and narrow frame.
Lots of straps and kinda revealing if you don't wear a cami. But I liked it for a summer night out!

links_Review_Title: Super boobalicious; light and airy; not work appropriate
links_Review_Text: I was hoping to wear this dress to a work-related event but it's way too revealing in the chest. Howeve at no point did I feel like I would be exposed. Definitely can't wear a bra with this. Other reviewers noted that this dress is see through. It's kind of shear but I just wore seamless brief panties under and felt fine. Great for vacation or a date with your partner. Be prepared for stares! Super lightweight and therefore perfect for the heat and humidity of a Texas summer.

I rented this dress for a family vacation in Scottsdale. It was the perfect fabric for a casual dinner after a hot day poolside! I loved the dark denim blue color of the fabric. It is totally see through, as reviews have already noted. I layered a bralette underneath for extra coverage because the plunging v neck over my itty bitty a cups was scandalous! Definitely recommend this dress for those who don't mind showing some skin.

links_Review_Title: See-through stunner for Miami or Beach Vacay
links_Review_Text: This dress fit beautifully and the back is super sexy. You can definitely see the bottom, so you'll wanna wear something cheeky and flirty to flaunt.

I wish I could've worn this! I'm a 4 but my rib cage is a pretty steady 6. I couldn't get it over my head and it has no zipper to access. The fabric is light and breezy - best worn with a slip (maybe) or as a coverup. Love this piece overall.

links_Review_Title: Perfect for a dressier beach cover up! I felt very glamorous making my pool entrance!
links_Review_Text: Definitely size down! I'm usually a 2-4 and wore the XS which was still large but looked cute and flown

I knew I was taking a little bit of a chance at size 14, 40C but this was ridiculous. The top fit more like a size small, I couldn't even get it over my chest. As others have mentioned it's pretty shear. I had a black slip I was going to wear, you'll want to find something. Gorgeous pattern, pretty soft fabric but not as silky as I expected.

Make sure you have confidence because this is a low cut dress! I personally really loved it but if I had a bigger chest there is no way I would have worn it. The fabric is very thin so be careful not to snag!

links_Review_Title: Not for petites and completely see-through
links_Review_Text: The dress has no give and was a little difficult to get on. I'm too short through the shoulders and the straps were too big and not adjustable. Definitely not for petites or curvy women. The fabric is also transparent so you can see everything through it. Such a disappointment because it's a pretty fabric and style. I picture it looking good on a tall, skinny lady. I obviously did not wear it.
Too big. I'm 110 and 32D. Very loose around the bust. Could not wear.

It was a little loose in the torso but really comfortable and the perfect maxi length. I kept this one for a while and lost track of how many times I wore it! Always got so many compliments. As other reviews say, it is pretty sheer and thin but didn't seem totally see through.
This is super thin and low cut. Not ideal for a family vacation if you're on the bustier side!
This dress was completely sheer. I couldn't get it over my chest, so I can comment on the overall fit.

I agree with other users- the material is a tad transparent, but the cut is sexy without being overly exposing. I love the exaggerated floral pattern, as well. Feminine but still modern and the back cut is nice as well. As a petite woman, I appreciated the length of the size small. It hit perfectly at the top of my feet, so I wasn't tripping over it! I wore it both as a cover up for my bathing suit for a pool party and another time, also to a separate pool bbq (where I knew I wasn't going swimming) so I didn't mind that it was transparent. This time, I layered a high waisted, full cut underwear with it and left the top as it. Got a ton of compliments, people thought the underpiece was a part of the dress!

I wore this to a vineyard with some friends and got so many compliments! It's insanely comfortable. My only complaint is that the top is too big/long aka showing lots of cleavage. But I ended up just tying the top into a halter (my hair covered it) and it worked perfectly!
Small in the chest are and see through. Would have to wear something underneath

links_Review_Title: Very cute only if you have small perky boobs
links_Review_Text: Neckline is was way to low cut and loose for my boobs, unfortunately couldn't wear. But the design color and print were beautiful.

Fit was beautiful and got tons of compliments. Was flattering and comfortable. Also allowed for wearing more comfortable shoes given the length. I am short so the straps were a little too loose - I was able to tie them up behind my neck to keep it taut. Also didn't wear a bra. I loved this dress!
This is a beautiful dress, but it did not look good on me. The fit is true to size, but I think it will better on someone with an A or B cup bra size , I am a C, so it looked nice, but a bit tight.

links_Review_Title: Looked great for my wine event.
links_Review_Text: Looks great. A little see thru.
Adorable dress. Very lightweight so perfect for coverup over swimsuit but not as a dress

links_Review_Title: Fun flowy dress, got lots of compliments for it
links_Review_Text: a bit too cleavagy for me so I wore a tank top underneath

This is not a dress. It is a beach coverup. It has no lining and must go over a bathing suit. The material is a rough cotton/linen and doesn't look like much but it is very cute on. Likely not something I would rent again, but cute for the beach.

So beautiful. Feminine. Light. Love love this designer. Only down side is it plunged quite deeply. If I owned it I would tailor to fit my petite frame. I did use the rope ties to create a "halter" tie back around the neck so it fit better. Also very shear - which I don't mind but I can see people would
Love the fabric, pattern, and cut. I had to wear a bralette for some added coverage of the tatas
Perfect as a beach coverup, or with a slip dress underneath bc it's quite sheer. A bit on the short side (but I'm really tall).

links_Review_Title: Large at top and very low cut, beautiful light fabric.
links_Review_Text: Large at top, pretty flow

links_Review_Title: Pretty but too showy for me
links_Review_Text: Very pretty summer dress, love the lightweight fabric and pattern. It is not lined, but I didn't find that to be a huge problem, nude undergarments would work well enough. The chest just didn't fit me well, much too revealing. I recently had a breast reduction so I am beyond excited to wear new styles but this one showed my scars too much.

links_Review_Title: Great length for short gals, but seethrough!
links_Review_Text: This dress fit SO well and was a perfect length that I could have even worn flats with it- but the back was a bit seethrough- you could see the outline of my butt :( Would recommend for a very casual setting over a bathing suit etc on a vacation
This dress was large and see through. I did not wear it.

links_Review_Title: Beautiful dress, not for small chests
links_Review_Text: Wow! A beautiful dress, great material, and fit perfect length wise (I'm 5'2"). I have a small chest and broad shoulders so this was hard to get on , and then once on, didn't have much to fill the front. I secured the front with two tiny safety pins to fix the gap. Tossed on a jean jacket & tan belt and it was great for date night.

links_Review_Title: Every dress should be this cut.
links_Review_Text: I LOVED the style of this dress. It made me feel so stylish and chic and sexy. The only hard thing was what bra to wear.
The dress is completely see through. There is no lining. Cute dress and fit well, but I needed a dress to wear not a bathing suit cover up; therefore, I did not wear it.
The material was a bit heavy so I suggest going a size down to add more hug especially around the chest area. Overall, great dress for a wedding or formal occasion!

I got compliments all night wearing this dress! The fit was excellent, though there was a little extra room in the bust area. I’m not small chested by any means so I think this would work good for women with larger chests as well. The color and fabric were luxurious. The length was perfect for my 5’6 height and I wore only a 2” heel. If you are the same height but going for a high heel I would recommend the long.

links_Review_Title: Stands out in a sea of black dresses
links_Review_Text: This dress is gorgeous and elegant! It's a great option for those with a larger bust. It was the right length for me, and the 14 probably had a little too much room in the hips, but that made for comfy sitting and dancing.

I rented this for our annual Mardi Gras ball and it was a showstopper! Loved the one shoulder detail and it was super comfortable. My only issue was the 18W was way too big in the bust area and we had to pin it in the back to make it secure otherwise it fit perfect. This was the backup size and while the 16R fit, it was a wee bit too tight in the hips/stomach area. If I could have taken the top part of that size and put it with the bottom part of the 18W it would have been perfect. Still pleased

I felt very elegant in this gown and received a ton of compliments ! It runs slight on the larger side but comfortable. I could have sized down for a snigger fit but it was fine. A few other dresses I tried in the same size I was unable to zip all the way. This dress is great if you have larger breasts. Overall.. I would wear again!

Rented for my organization's annual black tie fundraiser. This dress was a head turner and COMFY!! I am 5'3" and 142lbs, and it was a little long even with heels. If you're on the shorter side,, I would go with petite. Also, I used fabric tape/glue, to keep the one shoulder in place and it was a life saver! There are grippers around d the top of the bodice, but since I am kinda energetic on the dance floor I'm glad I used the tape and avoided a Janet Jackson moment in front of my boss. :)
Very comfortable

This dress was fantastic!! The fabric was so soft, the stretch in the fabric was perfect. I felt as good in the dress is I looked. I love Rent the Runway and being able to rent incredible dresses!!! Absolutely must rent this dress!!

This dress was perfect!! It hugged my body and made me feel incredible. I’d suggest some fashion tape for the non-sleeve side as it flipped over for me. It was a little loose on me so the tape did the trick!
Such a beautiful dress. Very flattering and elegant. Received compliments all night. Plus it was very comfortable and great for traveling.

links_Review_Title: The glamorous dress got so many compliments
links_Review_Text: Fit well in waist, hips and length. A bit loose in the bust — probably should have gotten a padded bra. Very comfy at a four hour event.
Loved the dress! It fit perfect and is true to size. So comfortable and I received many compliments.
This dress was perfect for our winter wedding at the botanic gardens. The color is amazing and the fit perfect.

links_Review_Title: I felt amazing in this dress!
links_Review_Text: Everything about this dress was spot on. The color, fit, comfort. Easy to move in with its flowing fabric. (I would recommend supporting undergarments to hide any bulges plus a strapless bra.) The dress was a hit! All night I heard "stunning", "elegant", and "beautiful ". I loved wearing this dress and would highly recommend.

I loved this dress! The color is actually more of a cranberry red, which was so pretty for a winter wedding. I received many compliments on it. It was very comfortable, even during dancing (it has some give). The top has a sticky tape to hold it up a bit but I added glamour tape to help it, or it would "turn down" and be visible. Overall, I felt great in it and was very unique in a sea of other dresses. I'm 5'3 and 115lbs and the 2P fit very well. Still a tiny bit long but fine with tall heels.
This dress was beautiful and the fit was perfect. Many compliments.

This dress is a standout color and style. I got so many compliments. However, the rosette flopped and was heavy, pulling in the top of the dress. It gave it a frumpy look. I also think I could have worn a smaller size as it was loose in the bust. The smaller size may have been tight through the middle so I can't be sure. It's worth a try but I'd order a size down for your backup.

links_Review_Title: Received compliments all night and the dress was spectacular for the gala I attended! Love RTW
links_Review_Text: Size 14L ..... 5'9 and then add three inch heels and the length was perfect. Comfortable for 5plus hours and was sad when I had to go home and take it off

I wore this to a black tie fundraising event. I am 5' 10", 160 lbs., and typically wear a 10 or 12 dress. This design is great for curves. The material was thick enough to cover undergarment lines but not too heavy for a warm Florida evening.

This dress was so perfect for a fall formal wedding. I'm 5'3 and wore with 5" wedges and the dress hit the floor fine for photos. The top band holding the structure of the dress in top could have been a little tighter (32A for reference) so I think someone with a little more curves than me on top might fill the dress a little more but I had no problem with it, didn't feel like I was pulling it up and was super super comfortable all night! Will rent again.
Stunning gown sure to make you stand out in a sea of LBDs. Comfy and well made. One shouldered flare adds a pretty little detail.
Easy to wear a beautiful dress
Worse this too a friends wedding and got so many compliments. Fit is perfect for late 2nd trimester, style is Hollywood glamour, color is perfection. So so happy with this dress.

Had a wedding to attend the following day, so went to the Rent The Runway store in Georgetown and found a dress in less than an hour. Wow! Felt great. Fit well. Easy to dance in. High quality material. Lots of compliments. Would definitely order it again! #glamorous #wedding #alittleoverdressed #worthit

I usually wear a size 12 in Jean's. I ordered the 14r bc I always need to size up (I wear a 38dd and have a bit of a tummy [apple shape]) it was slightly too big so I ended up wearing my second choice dress, but it was SO PRETTY. I will definitely order thus again in the correct size!

I didn't end up wearing this dress. It just fit strange. The top fabric was heavy and pulled down. I found it overall to be Ill-fitting and frumpy on my body type. Im 5'10" and have an athletic build. A long length would have fit better, but I also think this dress would work better for those with more curves.
Deep red color is beautiful and the fabric was far more forgiving than I expected.
Very comfortable, loved the color, lots of compliments!

The dress is gorgeous. However, it was to big for me. I feel like a 0 would have been to small. This was my first rental and the process was really smooth. Not sure if renting I right for me since I normally have to get alterations. Luckily, I had an outfit to wear.

links_Review_Title: I did not wear the gown. It was too big. That is why it is unforgettable.
links_Review_Text: IT was too long on the top.

links_Review_Title: The material felt wonderful and the rich ruby red color looked stunning especially on caramel skin!
links_Review_Text: This dress fit really well. I would've done well with a 4in heel. (I'm 5'1) My 3in heel had the dress brushing the floor a bit but it was on a red carpet so that actually worked out nicely. I did use stylist tape to keep the top from slipping over a bit, and i was able to wear a strapless bra for extra support too.

links_Review_Title: So many compliments on this dress!
links_Review_Text: Gorgeous!

links_Review_Title: Forgiving and flattering fit for busty without being too much!
links_Review_Text: Higher cut on the neck line was unexpectedly comfortable -- I'm used to sweetheart necklines hitting mid boob and this kept me perfectly tucked in! One shoulder, Nicky weighted drape and color all combine to be very forgiving and the right mix of sexy and formal!

Once I figured out how to wear the dress (initial attempt resulted in zipper being on my hip) it was great. Being north of 50 years old, I believe in shape wear which helped although material is such that lumps and bumps are not incredibly noticeable. I have broad shoulders and still need to do more crunches so the drape in the back hid imperfections well. I would have worn a waist trainer for more of an hourglass which this dress is perfect to emphasize. Length was perfect and allowed me to wear sneakers.

links_Review_Title: Didn't wear. Rented another dress that looked better on me. This one is gorgeous
links_Review_Text: Great color and fabric
Beautiful dress which fit well. I would've worn it, but my first choice dress fit perfectly

links_Review_Title: Great dress worn best with hair up so you can really show off your back and shoulder!
links_Review_Text: Fits great. I ordered a size 8 and it was true to size. The color is perfect for a holiday formal party or wedding and it's material is thick so you are still warm.

links_Review_Title: Lots of compliments! Color is a gorgeous red.
links_Review_Text: Beautiful dress. Got lots of compliments at the black tie affair.

This dress is so flattering. I’m 5’9” and ordered the long based on the recommendations. They didn’t have it so I had to get the regular. I wore it with 3 inch heels and it fell perfectly an inch or two off the ground so I didn’t have to worry about stepping on it. I’m a 12/14 normally. The 12 fit but was too tight for me to be comfortable all night at a work party. So I went with the 14 and I loved the way it looked! I can’t wait to wear this dress again!

links_Review_Title: I wore this to a black tie gala and have never received so many compliments
links_Review_Text: It’s perfect

links_Review_Title: Nice floral day dress for summer
links_Review_Text: I am usually between size 2 and 4 and went with the 2. There's plenty of room and very comfie material. Not that flattering but was great for walking around a city in the heat. Weird pic of me sitting on the ground but that's all I had.

I sized up in this knowing that dresses without any shape sometimes look bad on me (am a 4/6 but pretty curvy) and i was practically swimming in it! However I kind of loved the looser look and it was still flattering. Very pretty pattern and fabric, and comfortable too. Would wear to any occasion, work or fancy dinner or even a wedding. Will try again in a 4 at some point!
The dress ran slightly large, especially in the bust area. The fabric helped to make a more casual print a bit more elegant but did wrinkle easily.

This is the perfect summer dress! The fabric is a light silky material that looks really high quality. There is a lining so no risk of transparency. The ties on the arms are actually stitched so they are not adjustable. I am usually a 0 or 2 in tops and rented a size 2 - the straps slipped down a few times but nothing too bad. If I were to rent again, I would go with a 0 - so if you're between sizes, size down.

links_Review_Title: Great summer dress for a vineyard!
links_Review_Text: Great dress for a vineyard outing day! I grabbed this at the RTR store since my shipped item was too large. This was a size up from my usual size (they didn't have mine available, and I was desperate!), so while it fit well, can't wait to rent it again one size smaller. The right top hem from chest to shoulder flops over a bit--natural defect. You may want to pin it in place, if possible.

I wore this to an anniversary dinner at a nice restaurant where it would be pretty hot inside (San Francisco no a/c, lord help me). This dress has thick enough straps to wear a bra, is loose and flowy enough to handle a whole tasting menu, and the color is my boyfriend's favorite. Win, win!

links_Review_Title: Lovely dress, good material, great for summer
links_Review_Text: A little right on the lower chest area. Everything else fit perfectly. I got a lot compliments over this dress. It's so soft and comfy.

links_Review_Title: Easy, breathable dress for a summer wedding. In fact, I wore it twice and even took it on vacation.
links_Review_Text: The fit is great except I have more hip than bust so the straps kept falling a bit. Beyond that it was a great look, easy dress - Though it does wrinkle, so be prepared for that with a steamer.
If you have a butt or Tummy avoid avoid avoid

links_Review_Title: Pretty dress perfect for wine tasting
links_Review_Text: Dress fits perfectly, super feminine and cute, especially for visiting the country side for wine tasting

Beautiful dress, but the fit was off. I am rather short-waisted for my height and the cut of the bodice was too long for my build. I am a solid size 8 with wide shoulders, a wide chest, and wide hips. This dress fit slightly large in the bust and waist. Not quite enough to recommend sizing down, but if you're between sizes, you might err on the smaller size.

links_Review_Title: I got lots of compliments on it, but felt a bit self-conscious because of the low cut.
links_Review_Text: I wore this for two occasions — on a date and to a winery with friends — but would have worn it more if it didn't show off 'the ladies' so much. The fabric is not too thin, but it doesn't stretch and you must either wear very discreet underwear or none at all if you don't want to have to wear a slip or something to hide the lines. It's so low cut in the front, I couldn't wear my strapless bra with it. The fact that it has no stretch leaves you gapping in the chest and straps falling down if you slouch at all when sitting. If it was any smaller, it wouldn't have fit in the butt area.
I wore this to work, paired with some high-waisted black pants. I loved the fit, material and overall fun look of this.

I wore this multiple times with the high waisted skirt in the picture for work and then on the weekends with high waisted black skinny jeans and some high waisted linen striped pants. Felt super chic and got a lot of compliments. Would've kept if it wasn't so pricey.

So glad I got the XL on this one. I'm usually a Medium but this was perfect. Also a bit short, even for a crop top so perfect to pair with high waisted jeans. It did wrinkle easily so had to iron. I would consider buying.

This is a super flattering top, which can sometimes be a struggle with my slightly larger bust (32D). Perfect with white high waisted jeans. I wore this to the US Open and got tons of compliments, so wore it for another event as well. Works for both day and night looks! Would rent again.
Perfect fit for my broad shoulders and small waist. Casual and yet so well made.
Definitely a crop top but was such a hit with a high waisted skirt Definitely recommend
Great top for a dinner I'm Vegas. Casual but not boring!

links_Review_Title: Adorable denim crop top with ruffles- seems to run a little small
links_Review_Text: Please note this is a crop top or least almost is a crop top! But if paired with the right pants it can look super cute. I wore it with high waisted wide legged pants and it made for such a cute outfit. I have a pretty small chest and this top fit me perfectly but just barely. I could see if I had a bigger chest, it may be too tight. Seems to run a little small. Very cute though!
I normally would have ordered the small, but I went with the medium because I have a larger chest. I definitely have some extra room, but it fits and still looks cute!

links_Review_Title: It's an easy top to pair with anything. Ruffles make it fun and flirty without trying too hard:)
links_Review_Text: Cropped right at belly button

links_Review_Title: Dress it up or dress it down.
links_Review_Text: I should have worn a Medium instead of a Small. It is definitely a crop top, and luckily I have high waisted pants to wear with it. The fabric gets wrinkled easily. Otherwise, I appreciated the style.

Loved this top so much I bought it!! It goes well with all high waisted pants / skirts / shorts and I've worn it several times already. I have broad shoulders and this is quite fitted so I am glad I purchased the Large (normally I wear a medium in most tops).

Rented this to wear with skirts and dress pants. It was more cropped than I had realized so I had to get creative with what I paired it with bc I don't love to show too much skin. Anything high waisted meets this top well. I also wore it under a v neck romper kind of as a shell. Lots of compliments there! Overall a very high quality, trendy piece!
Loved it so much I almost bought it!

links_Review_Title: Nice combination of avant-garde and sweet
links_Review_Text: I liked the style of this top because the ruffles definitely gave it a feminine feeling, but they are very bold and unusual so that cut down on it being too cutsey. I think it could be styled in a lot of different ways to pull it in either of those directions, which is a real plus. I wore it with a short flared skirt which felt very girly, but it also looks nice with highwaisted black jeans for a more modern look, and paired with a more voluminous skirt or pants it has an edgier high-fashion oversize feeling. I got the top in a S instead of XS because I really didn’t want it to feel constricting or too short – I was very happy with the roomier fit of the S but I am sure having worn it that the XS would have been ok too, just a little tighter (and likely a bit shorter). On my frame, it was not overly cropped – it comfortably fit over skirt that fit at the natural waist.
Great shirt that can pair well with many different style pants. I paired it with these Haute Hippie pants (another RTR piece) and received so many compliments. Highly recommended!
This shirt is very unique and fits so well
I had a hard time finding bottoms I already owned to go with this. It also runs big so it didn't look great since it didn't really fit.

links_Review_Title: This top is SO CUTE! Rent it!
links_Review_Text: This top is to die for. It's casual but dressy enough for dinner or out for drinks. The ruffles are a great touch. It fit me TTS - I am a size 4 in dresses, 26 in denim and wear a 32C bra. Rent it! I regret not buying it!
High wasted so looks cute when you tuck something over or wear jeans and show mid section

This shirt can be dressed up for work or down for the weekend. I probably could have sized down, as the sleeves were big and you could see my bra on the side. However the shirt is cropped, so if you're between sizes and choose to size down, keep that in mind. Overall, I found it to be a fun and flirty top :)

As others mentioned, the shirt is probably too cropped to be able to wear to work, unless you have something super high-waisted. I wore this to a concert with friends and the hint of stomach was perfect :)
I would have preferred a size up because I couldn't wear a bra because the shirt was snug and a little uncomfortable but not to the point of feeling like a stuffed sausage.

Fits true to size but is cropped as others have pointed out. On me it comes to 1 inch above belly button. Also I have a 36" bust measurement and it fits just perfectly there, so more busty women might need to size up.

links_Review_Title: Cute crop cut and trendy ruffle
links_Review_Text: The top is meant for longer torsos because it bunched up a little on my shorter torso. The fabric is soft and casual and will look good dressed up or down.

links_Review_Title: A true crop top, sassy and fun
links_Review_Text: Wore this on a much-needed getaway to Florida. Went great with high waisted jeans. It's a true crop so if you don't want your stomach to show at all, wear very high waisted jeans or don't get it!
Rented for a bachelorette weekend. It's a little cropped so look cute with high waisted jeans/ pants. The ruffles add something different to a simple chambray top.

I loved this cute chambray top. I wore it once with high waisted black pants and then again with white linen pants. It would also look cute with a midi skirt! The ruffles came a little wrinkly in the mail, but it was easy to straighten them out. This shirt also has no stretch, so be careful when picking your size.
Great with a high waist skirt for work!
This is an adorable shirt, Burt be aware that is more cropped than it looks on the model. I didn't have the right high waisted item to pair with it so I ended up sending it back.

This is a cute top. I found that the ruffles didn't really want to sit where they were supposed to. I am between an xs and s when it comes to tops. I originally ordered the xs and couldn't even get it over my chest (and I don't have a particularly large chest), so size up if you are wavering on sizes. I paired the top with a skirt that bells out at the bottom. Kind of felt like a farm girl going to a picnic... but in a good way.

I loved everything about this too. I followed the other reviews that it ran small and ordered a large. I am long waisted and wanted to make sure I gave my torso plenty of length. I paired it with this skirt, which is also RTR after I saw another girl with this outfit! The shirt definitely needs something high waisted unless you have the bod for a mid-drift shirt. The ruffles kept their shape and it was a very cute cut. I do not have a big chest, so I would guess that if you are very chesty, this shirt would not work for you. Can't wait to rent this again! So many compliments!

So unique! I love the ruffles on this top. This runs true to size and we recommend sizing up. Since there is not stretch, this works best for A to C cups. This may be worn with a standard bra. Wear this top with black pants and simple earrings!

Oh it's a short top. I'm not comfortable showing my stomach, paired with some high waisted jeans I was a-ok. Wore this out for drinks with friends. Felt a little weird because the ruffle sleeves aren't my thing but I looked nice in photographs. Lots of compliments

links_Review_Title: Such a fun crop top for work or fun
links_Review_Text: Such a fun crop top! I loved this and got so many compliments. I also paired with a high waisted, wide-legged cropped pant and heels for work.
Wore this with high waisted pants, but still had to wear a tank under. Runs a little short, but super cute !

links_Review_Title: What a fun twist on a basic chambray too!!
links_Review_Text: The only size available was an XL which was true to size and too big, but I could tuck the crop top into my skirt and it worked just fine. Usually I worry about cap sleeves being unflattering for my arms, but this top didn't have that problem. I wore it to brunch on Sunday and then to work later in the week. It was perfect with the white cotton skirt for brunch and a white pencil for work. I loved it and would happily rent it again!

links_Review_Title: Holding onto this one for a little :)
links_Review_Text: Obsessed with this chambray top. I first am wearing it to work with a pleated skirt and block heel sandals. But going to wear it again this Friday night out to dinner on the shore, maybe with white pants and a bright sandal. Great fit and just super cute and on trend.
Pictures don't do this top justice. The form, the fabric, the details.... its beautiful and can easily transition from day to night.

Nothing says summer like a chambray top! I loved the length of this, it is a bit cropped hitting just below the natural waist. The ruffle detail dressed it up however I paired with high waisted white denim shorts for an every day look. Definitely a piece I would buy!!
Fit perfect, I'm 5'2 was good length. Would rent again
I think it runs a little small. I wore the xl. I'm usually a 10 in dresses, 8 or 10 in pants/shorts/skirts. I received lots of compliments.
This is my newest favorite little black dress! The lace and back make it sexy, yet sophisticated. I'm a solid 8, and I chose the large. It fit like a glove. I highly recommend!

links_Review_Title: Very comfortable and tons of compliments!
links_Review_Text: I didn’t realize the dress was velvet but ended up loving it!!

I rented this for NYE and loved it! So did hubby. It has an asymmetric hem that makes it interesting. It is quite short and appears even shorter since the bottom 3-4 inches is lace with no lining, but since the top is all covered up and has long sleeves I think it's a nice balance. The open back allowed me to wear strapless bra and high waist spanx with no problem. I loved wearing this one!
This dress fit perfectly and I received many compliments. It's a bit short, but on months tall so the length worked for me.

I rented for a holiday party. The dress is velvety which was a pleasant surprise. It is SUPER short. I am 5ft and the shorter side of the dress was way up on my thigh. There is little to no stretch so I would suggest sizing up. I was between the small and medium but ultimately went with the small because the tighter fit was a better look with this dress. The medium was too big in the shoulders and roomy in the body that made the back cutout loose. I received several compliments! Pretty and fun!
Super cute, but too young for this 61 yr old. Ran a little small, but has some stretch. Sleeves are very itchy and the dress is very lightweight

links_Review_Title: Beautiful accessories. Loved fit and comfort of the dress. Items sent beautifully - great packaging

links_Review_Text: Wore this to my graduation from a masters program. It was extremely short. I am not a tall person. I'm 5'5. If you are 5'4 or taller, would not suggest. I was constantly worried because it was so short

This dress is hands-down gorgeous. It fits beautifully and was a great length; not too short for date night, just the right amount of flirty. The back is stunning; lays just right and adds that extra pop. Love it!
Super short. Be prepared to wear something under this and not lift your arms above your head. But it's a super fun and cute dress.
Fit well overall! It does have some stretch, so it was comfortable to dance in all night. I would rent again but it was too memorable!

links_Review_Title: He Brought the Jeans and I brought the BLING to a local Jeans & Bling Charity Event!
