The dress has one of those hide-away zippers, you may need a second person to help zip it up because it is a little tricky. Overall great dress! Would love to rent again!

I loved this dress. I was a bit skeptical on the style because I'm a larger girl so I took a risk and it was so worth it. I felt amazing all night and loved the way the dress flared out when I danced. If you're a bustier girl you can also probably get away with not wearing a bra, I did!

links_Review_Title: The dress fit so well and was very flattering on me. I had no issues!
links_Review_Text: I didn't have to wear a bra thankfully due to the elastic hold at the top. It was very flattering on my waste and hips. I'm 5'2 and it was the perfect length, love love love!

I loved this dress. It's definitely more off white/tan than it appears in the pictures, but I think that's a good thing. I decided to wear the 4 in this dress because the rib cage felt a little too tight in the size 2 even though that's my normal size. The material is nice and light, great if you'll be outdoors.
I didn't end up wearing this because it hit me at an awkward length, but I'm 6 foot tall. It gave me such a cute waist though and I loved everything else about it.

You know the dress is perfect when you get cat called by another woman on a NYC street, "oh my god she looks BANGIN'! Yas girl!" Very figure flattering for my hourglass shape and the adjustable straps are an amazing thing that every dress should have. Perfect for a springtime wedding!
I got so many compliments on this dress! The material was thick enough so I didn't need a slip. Loved it!!

The sizing starts at 2 and I usually wear a 0 so I was worried it would fit too large but it fit perfectly! The straps are adjustable and the chest area fit fine and didn't need a bra (I wore a push up strapless though). The length hit just below the knee for me so I wore it with heels and wasn't too tight or too loose anywhere below the chest. Great dress for spring events and great for dancing!
I am a President circle winner for my company and wore this dress to the final awards dinner, which was held outdoor in Cancun. The dress is gorgeous! I felt like a movie star! So many compliments!

links_Review_Title: Fun and flirty dress...just a little odd on my body
links_Review_Text: I really fell in love with this dress for our trip to the islands. Unfortunately, it just fit my body a little odd. It was comfortable and pretty, just not my favorite dress. Perhaps if I were a bit taller (I'm 5' 4.5") it would have layed on my body better. I wouldn't rent it again, but it was fun to wear once.

links_Review_Title: I wore this to my Bridal Tea and I felt like royalty in this dress!
links_Review_Text: I'm 5' 6" and 115 lbs and it fit like a glove! I'd go up a size if you have larger than B cups though because there isn't a ton of room there. I didn't need a bra with it even though it's not padded because it had several layers of fabric in that area. The adjustable straps were a lifesaver! The length is so ladylike and looked great with my yellow Sam Edelmans! 10/10 recommend this dress for any daytime special occasion.

links_Review_Title: Comfortable and Flattering for hourglass figure
links_Review_Text: I wore this dress to a fairly casual outdoor summer wedding, and I was happy with my choice. I have big hips and this dress showed off my figure in a flattering way. I was a tiny bit concerned when renting that the cleavage would be too much, but it's actually modestly cut up top. I really liked the unique pattern.
This dress was very comfortable and flattering. The only thing is the mid section belt area has no give.
Runs true to size. I'm 5'9 and hits at the knee. Great for tall girls.
I wore this for my dad's 70th birthday. On its own, it's very chic but I dressed it down a bit with a jean jacket. Really well made and hugged my body well. Loved it!

I loved this dress! It was slightly long but the adjustable straps made it work. It's very fitted (tad smaller than other 4s) in the bust/back, so if you have a larger chest (I'm a 32DD), you may want to size up. Waist and hips were true to size so a little looser than I'd normally wear, but overall, I was very pleased! Considering purchasing this since it is flattering and footed while still being a modest length and appropriate for many occasions.

The dress was a different material than I was expecting, it is not cotton! But it hung nicely. I did have to wear spanx and a corset with the dress to keep everything smooth. I wore this dress for Dapper Day at Disney's Animal Kingdom and received many compliments. It was cool and comfy to wear all day in the Florida humidity.
I wore this to a casual country wedding with a Jean jacket and boots. Got tons of compliments!

The fabric didn't have a lot of stretch so I’m glad I sized up for the backup size. For girls with wide rib cages like me, expect it to be a bit tight around your ribs/waist. The dress was a hit at the wedding I attended. I received multiple compliments.

links_Review_Title: I loved the dress. I got a lot of compliments. I am 5'7 and 170 lbs and 36 DD.
links_Review_Text: Snug around rib and breast area

links_Review_Title: Super flatting and a touch of vintage style
links_Review_Text: This was my backup dress and based off other reviews I chose a size 6. I normally wear a 4. The shape is flattering and I liked the fully adjustable straps! I typically can’t go without a bra (I'm 32DD) - there was space for one but it wasn’t necessary. If you have a butt it will hug nicely and look good with the flounce hem. I might have been able to fit into the 4, but it would’ve been fitted. I’m 5’0” and this was about mid-shin on me. The zipper was hard to do. The first time I tried it on I needed someone else to do it. After that I was okay by myself with a lot of force. I wore this to brunch the day after a wedding. It was easy to dress down with flats and a colored sweater. The base is cream (not beige or tan like a couple other reviews said). Because it’s cream, I think it could be acceptable to wear to a wedding but personally I don’t think I would. I liked the cute pattern and loved the cut. It was a hint of vintage, not over-the-top-retro. It was easy to move around in and not heavy at all! I even wore it on my flight home and it was really comfortable.
I liked this dress, and felt like it looked better in person than online. It did bunch up a little sometimes, but overall it was comfortable and pretty.

links_Review_Title: Loved this dress. Worn for my husbands 20 year reunion.
links_Review_Text: This dress was simple and beautiful. I wish it had been a little more fitted around the waist and hips, but it still worked out great. I got lots of compliments on it. I have a broad back so finding a dress that I could zipper but still looked good was a plus for me. I would rent it again for sure.
I'm usually a size 4 but ended up wearing a 2 in this dress. Bust was a tad tight but still fight better than the 4. Very flattering shape and got so many compliments, highly recommend!
I was able to wear a strapless bra by going up a size. The straps kept falling, but overall the dress was a hit!

links_Review_Title: Fit great. A lot of compliments
links_Review_Text: Fit great, received a lot of compliments

This dress fit true to size. I'm 5'7" and it was the perfect length. The straps are adjustable which is helpful. It was great for an outside wedding. Very light and breathable. Would definitely recommend renting this dress!
Was overall happy with my dress rented. It fit great everywhere except the chest area. It was a little large and wouldn't sit right for me.

I rented this dress to wear for a bridal shower that was floral themed. I felt the fit of the dress is a little off, especially for me who has some curve. I ordered a 10 which is what I normally wear and I got the 12 just in case...sometimes I am right in between. I got my dresses and the 10 was so snug, but the 12 was way too big...like falling off me! If they made an 11, it would have been perfect. I am 5'5 and 150lbs with a 36D. I ended up wearing the 10, because at least it wasn't going to fall off, but here were the pros and cons: The idea of the dress is super cute with the little kick ruffle at the bottom, but the waist is cut as a natural waist, which I have to be careful with because of my stomach. The snug fit of the dress made my pooch pop out a little too much for comfort. The boob line under the dress wouldn't "stay put", and the straps wouldn't stay up. The whole day, the dress was a bit fussy. All that said, I did get a lot of compliments on it, but I was just not comfortable. For someone shaped like the model, I am sure it would be really cute. I now know, I cannot wear this style. :(

I ordered this dress as a back-up and didn't end up wearing it, although I really loved it. I don't have a very large chest (lol ok I don't have one at all), and sometimes sweetheart necklines like this flatter that, however this dress really made it more noticeable. It also ran a little big and I needed to tighten the straps substantially so they wouldn't slide off my shoulders - although it was super convenient that you COULD adjust them. If I had worn this one, no bra would have been necessary. The tulip/flare of the skirt was VERY flattering, though. Also, the base is more of a cream color than white, so I wouldn't worry about wearing it to a wedding (I had several people express concern about this when I showed them the picture online, but I think it would have been fine). Fun dress!
I wore this for a daytime baby shower. It was overall a very comfortable dress. The seem across the waist is quite snug though.

links_Review_Title: Nice dress for a day event
links_Review_Text: I wore this dress to a graduation brunch. The print was fun and kept it less formal. It ran a tad small on top but overall pretty true to size. Make to size up for your second dress

links_Review_Title: Really nicely cut neckline fun to show off the leg
links_Review_Text: The cut in the waist is just under the boobs, I like when it's cut in at my waist. Was very short, and not much room around my legs (I have a bigger butt/thighs compared to my upper body)
Loved this dress and it was the perfect length for short girls!
Wow, this dress has a beautiful design and flatters your shape. Surprisingly warm, be careful can sweat if too warm outside. Would rent again.

This dress is beautiful! The pattern is gorgeous. The material is lightweight- the arms are sheer but there is a built in slip for the body of the dress. The cut of the dress is very flattering - especially for a short torso - and hides imperfections around the middle. The dress is a little short I'm 5'2 and it hits above the knee.

This dress was just perfect! I loved the high neck with the shorter length. The sleeves have elastic, so I pulled them up a bit to create a gathered look about half way up my forearm, which was fun! This dress is lightweight, but not sheer. Loved it!

Styling: Wore with black tights and short tan booties Fit: Thought I would need to belt it to tighten and make the waist sit right, but at the end of the day hit my waist in comfortable and flattering way. Pros: Could dress up or down, did not wrinkle in my luggage, open slit in back didn't show bra Cons: Could've used help buttoning the neck buttons- add an extra 5 min to getting ready if riding solo!

Love the mock neck, deep red colouring in the floral, back detail, empire waist and length. It is perfect for petite frames. The arms aren't too long because there is an elastic which prevents them from falling down past your wrists. It's more flattering in person than in photos. High quality construction. Will definitely rent again.

I wore this all day on Easter - from church to a few different events. I received so many compliments! Fit is true to size (I may have even been able to size down). By the end of the night the sleeves seemed to "grow", but I'm short so I'm used to it. They were also elasticized which helped.

links_Review_Title: Very pretty, memorable and comfortable dress
links_Review_Text: Loved the style of this dress and it was very comfortable and easy to wear and didn't wrinkle when I packed it for my business trip. Only negative is that I felt like I was too tall for it (I'm 5'9") and the elastic waist was higher than my natural waist and it looked better if I pulled the waist down (otherwise it kind of bunched below my chest which is small) and it was short but looks cute with black tights so all worked.

links_Review_Title: It was for work. It was nice to wear to meetings, etc.
links_Review_Text: Loved this dress. It fit well, I liked the print, and I felt like it looked good on me. This was a nice dress to wear to work.

I loved this! I was worried that it would be too tight and short based on reviews so I ordered the 8, and it was perfect, even a touch big. The blousy sleeves and high neckline and waist made this so chic. I paired with a high bun and black tights for work. It's easy and beautiful!

links_Review_Title: Beautiful silk dress for winter rehearsal dinner
links_Review_Text: This dress fit like a glove in my regular size at 17 weeks pregnant. The dress is very high quality, sexy but conservative, and got tons of compliments. It's is definitely on the short sized if you are taller so I wore it with leggings and boots.

This is one of the most comfortable dresses I've worn and the quality is very good. There are no zippers and no ties - it just slips on over head and has a few buttons at the neck. The elastic can be worn higher under the bustline or lower closer to the waist depending on your preference. I felt feminine and pretty in this and it's work appropriate although I would have preferred it be an inch longer. I wore it with a layered gold necklace that has a little tassel on the end (thanks to Rachel Zoe's Box of Style!). I am keeping this dress for awhile so I can try it with heeled mules and a leather jacket for date night w/my hubby.

It fit great! The sleeves were long enough -- which is great since I'm so y'all. The waist is elastic and very forgiving. It was on the short side, but was great with tights. AND this is a photo of me in the dress with Rebecca Minkoff!!

links_Review_Title: I got tons of compliments on this. I wore it to a holiday happy hour.
links_Review_Text: The waist is very high and hit me mid rib cage. The fabric is gorgeous and was very comfortable. I wore it with black tights and boots in the winter in Houston TX. It hit me a couple of inches above my knees. I am 5’5”, short waisted and normally wear a 8. I would have never bought this and it was a perfect thing to rent. Slightly out of my comfort zone but not too daring.

I didn't realize by the pic that this was a turtleneck. I don't like turtlenecks in general and this one was especially uncomfortable... too tight. The material is pretty. The sleeves are great. It's a little shorter than I expected. Would have needed tights to avoid flashing anyone. Didn't end up wearing it. Sent it back right away.
This dress didn't fit at all like it looks on the model. I still liked it, but if you're looking for a loose fit and have hips I'd suggest going two sizes up.

The quality of this dress was great and the print is beautiful. The cinching sits slightly above the waist line which makes the skirt more flowy. Fit was true to size and the puff sleeves and high neck make the dress very elevated. Highly reccomend!

links_Review_Title: A little short, wire with opaque tights.

links_Review_Text: I am 5'4", this dress was very much on the short side for work, although would have been ok with opaque tights. However I couldn't wear it because the neck was so extremely tight that it could barely button, felt like I was choking and I do not have a large neck at all.
I rented this for a bar mitzvah and it was so cute, the print is even prettier in person. It's pretty true to size but runs a little small. It does have an open back so you might want to wear a slip.
I'm curvy and this was very flattering.

links_Review_Title: Fun dress that I was able to wear to work too
links_Review_Text: I really liked this dress. The elastic comes right under the breast. Light fabric and a great print. Many many compliments all day long. Although the dress was not short on me while standing up, definitely couldn't bend over without all the goods being seen.
Cute dress! I did not get to wear it because it didn't fit. It wasn't true to size.
Nothing else to add.
Very feminine and unique. A little short, but works with over the knee boots or tights for work. I would love to buy it.

links_Review_Title: Wore it to work got tons of compliments.
links_Review_Text: Great fabric, colors, quality. Love the sleeves. A little bit small and short but I wore it anyway
The pictures are a bit deceiving. This is an empire waist and sits much higher than my natural waist. Also, tight through the hips and very short.
Flattering and forgiving. Keep it for a few weeks to wear more than once to different events.
Very comfortable, flattering and beautiful dress. I'd like to own it.
Perfect.

links_Review_Title: Lots of coworkers loved the dress.
links_Review_Text: I love this dress with black tights and booties for work.
This was a cute dress for a date. It has a conservative neckline but is cut shorter at the hem. The waist gives it a good shape.
Didn't wear as was too short but will probably size up and rent again soon.

This 14 fit like a 12, with the exception that the back was a little loose hanging for me. Everywhere else fit great. I'm 5'8" and this was short when I sat down. Wore with black tights and booties. Silk fabric felt nice but lining is polyester. Would not purchase this dress for the price knowing it wasn't all silk. Overall happy with wearing it.
Loved this dress! So gorgeous and comfortable - with lovely details and breathable sleeves. A bit short but perfect with tights.
na
I wore this to work with tights and heels. The fabric is light enough though that it could be worn in the summer. The dress was very comfortable and I received lots of compliments
Wore to a baby shower and it was really cute! I sized up to size 6 to fit my 28 week baby bump and it was perfect (normally a size 2/4)
Nice dress but felt small for my size. Very short so I did not end of wearing it.
